programme.desc: Fata and Yankuba are two young Gambians with ambitious dreams, who fled dictatorship and poverty and landed in Naples, only to discover a new kind of violence: a pernicious climate of racism and an unhelpful immigration system.

programme.title: World Cup Slaves
programme.desc: Nepalese men employed in Qatar's construction industry tell Robert Booth how they work for little or no pay as they build the infrastructure ahead of the 2022 football World Cup.

programme.title: Harvest - is freezing my eggs the answer?
programme.desc: Conflicted about motherhood, Sophia embarks on the physically and emotionally gruelling journey of harvesting her eggs in her 30s.

programme.title: How a community fought the Louisiana floods | How algorithms are cutting Americans' healthcare
programme.desc: The Cajun Army: how a community fought the Louisiana floods | Automating Care: How algorithms are cutting Americans' healthcare

programme.title: The Black Panther Cubs: when the revolution doesn't come
programme.desc: They are the children of the Black Panther party – the self-styled Panther cubs. Born into the 1970s revolutionary movement for Black equality and self-determination, they have lived in the shadows of a promised land that was never attained.

programme.title: How we created ultra-processed food from industrial waste | Snowflake, Arizona: where the residents are allergic to life
programme.desc: How we created ultra-processed food from industrial waste | Snowflake, Arizona: where the residents are allergic to life

programme.title: Skyward: birdwatching is belonging for two teenage conservationists
programme.desc: Young birdwatchers Mya and Arjun feel the pressure of climate breakdown and the biodiversity crisis. As two reserved teenagers on the cusp of adulthood, they find comfort in birdwatching while being distant from their peers.

programme.title: Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria | The Yamuna, India's most polluted river
programme.desc: Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria: 'We're American, too, why don't they help?' | The Yamuna, India's most polluted river

programme.title: Feeding Liverpool from an ice-cream van | The view from Blackpool on byelection day
programme.desc: The women feeding Liverpool from an ice-cream van | 'Fed up of politics': the view from Blackpool on byelection day

programme.title: The internet warriors
programme.desc: Who are the people that get so angry online? Meet the internet warriors, in their own homes.

programme.title: Refusing to fight: Israelis against the war in Gaza
programme.desc: For many Israelis, military service is a rite of passage that lasts two to three years. Being such a formative part of the social contract in Israel, it is unusual for eligible young people to refuse their draft orders.

programme.title: On the Ground
programme.desc: The people against King Charles: how protesters are getting ready for the coronation | Are French protesters more effective? Meet the ‘next level’ climate activists

programme.title: Black Enough?
programme.desc: Anime has a race problem, here's how black fans are fixing it | Why horror keeps creeping into black drama

programme.title: Black Enough?
programme.desc: From Burna Boy to Beyoncé: how black culture is embracing its African roots | Why the first US cowboys were black? | How 'Voodoo' became a metaphor for evil

programme.title: Modern Masculinity - S1
programme.desc: Season 1: Why Jordan Peterson is filling the void | Men need meaning and responsibility | What makes a man?

programme.title: On the Ground
programme.desc: The fall of Nagorno-Karabakh: 'I've lost a child, and now a homeland' | Into the wild to fight Scotland’s addiction problems

programme.title: Second innings
programme.desc: From Afghanistan to London, three boys build a new life playing cricket. Tucked away in suburban south London, matches take place every week for young and often traumatised asylum seekers.

programme.title: Right to fight: Martial arts fighter with Down's syndrome
programme.desc: Garrett Holeve (aka G Money) has always dreamt of being a Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) fighter, and with the full support of his parents, prepares to fight another disabled opponent. But Florida authorities deemed the contest a health risk.

programme.title: The Trial
programme.desc: Alka Pradhan, James Connell and Sterling Thomas are lawyers for Ammar al-Baluchi, one of five men facing the death penalty for plotting the 2001 terror attacks in the US.

programme.title: Abortion in Mexico | The women protesting Poland's new abortion law
programme.desc: Abortion in Mexico: Catholics, the law and the right to choose | 'Sex is not a crime': the women protesting Poland's new abortion law

programme.title: I fled Ukraine with my son | Refugees in Calais
programme.desc: I fled Ukraine with my son. Now we're going back home | Refugees in Calais: ‘house them like the Ukrainians’

programme.title: Malcolm Gladwell in conversation with Ben Fountain | Stewart Lee in conversation with Alan Moore
programme.desc: Malcolm Gladwell in conversation with Ben Fountain | 'I'll write as if I'm trying to get sacked': Stewart Lee in conversation with Alan Moore

programme.title: Pretty radical: a young woman's journey into the heart of Poland's far right
programme.desc: We follow 19-year-old Paulina, who joins Poland’s far-right National Radical Camp.

programme.title: The new green superpower? Oil giant Kazakhstan tries to wean itself off the black stuff
programme.desc: Kazakhstan is rich with oil, gas and coal but Nursultan Nazarbayev, its president for life, has committed the country to a dramatic shift from fossil fuels to green energy.

programme.title: How a conference call sparked America's abortion obsession | The Daphne Project
programme.desc: How a conference call sparked America's abortion obsession | The Daphne Project: 'Journalism was her life': Daphne Caruana Galizia's family speak out

programme.title: The Wolf Dividing Norway
programme.desc: With unique access to remote communities in the snow-capped landscape of Norway, this film follows characters on either side of a fierce debate on whether to cull the wolf population.

programme.title: Climate carnage: whose job is it to save the planet?
programme.desc: In a crucial year for the climate, award-winning Guardian environment editor Fiona Harvey reflects on 30 years of Cops and meets the politicians, activists and scientists asking who is responsible for saving the planet.

programme.title: Why is Vladimir Putin so obsessed with Ukraine? | I count myself as a Black Ukrainian
programme.desc: Why is Vladimir Putin so obsessed with Ukraine? | I count myself as a Black Ukrainian: the fashion designer starting again in Budapest

programme.title: Paris: where street basketball meets hip-hop | Mark Rothko murals at Tate Modern
programme.desc: Paris: where street basketball meets hip-hop | Waves of mysterious meaning: Mark Rothko murals at Tate Modern

programme.title: Life in the Arctic | The poets taking on climate change
programme.desc: Life in the Arctic: how climate change is killing a culture | High ice and hard truth: the poets taking on climate change

programme.title: The Mexican women who kicked out | Mumbai's all-female taxi firm | Veiled rapper breaking taboos
programme.desc: The Mexican women who kicked out the cartels | Drive for women's empowerment: Mumbai's all-female taxi firm | The veiled rapper breaking taboos for women in Senegal

programme.title: From dealing drugs to delivering food: Pastor Mick on Burnley's Covid crisis
programme.desc: Pastor Mick Fleming has devoted all of his time in this lockdown to supporting the poorest communities in Burnley. But his life hasn’t always been this way.

programme.title: Why is anti-immigration sentiment on the rise in Canada?
programme.desc: Canada has long been celebrated for its welcoming stance towards immigrants, fostering a prosperous, multicultural society. But in recent years, rising concerns over living costs and housing shortages have fueled a mounting scepticism of the country’s mass immigration policies.

programme.title: The Syrian spaceman who became a refugee | Netflix fans uncover the real life of Pablo Escobar
programme.desc: The Syrian spaceman who became a refugee | Narcotours: Netflix fans uncover the real life of Pablo Escobar

programme.title: Feeding Liverpool from an ice-cream van | The view from Blackpool on byelection day
programme.desc: The women feeding Liverpool from an ice-cream van | 'Fed up of politics': the view from Blackpool on byelection day

programme.title: Pressure and Release: horse therapy for young Indigenous Australians
programme.desc: The Kimberley region of Western Australia is a beautiful place. But it is home to communities in crisis – devastated by a pattern of suicides among young Aboriginal people.

programme.title: A love letter to Notting Hill Carnival | Inside New York's underground ballroom scene
programme.desc: A love letter to Notting Hill Carnival | Inside New York's underground ballroom scene: 'It's your chosen family'

programme.title: Fish story
programme.desc: Sometime in the 1980s, Caspar Salmon's grandmother was invited to a gathering on the Welsh island of Anglesey, attended exclusively by people with fish surnames. Or so he says. Thirty years later, film-maker Charlie Lyne attempts to sort myth from reality.

programme.title: Rebranded | The Iraqi girls who escaped from Isis
programme.desc: Rebranded: how Survivors Ink is erasing the marks of the US sex trafficking industry | The Iraqi girls who escaped from Isis

programme.title: The UK's first professional trans choir: 'It's a joyful act of resistance'
programme.desc: Anil Sebastian and Coda Galabov are the creators of a new choir called Trans Voices, which offers a space for trans and non-binary people who have felt unable to sing with their true voices in traditional choirs.

programme.title: 'Revenge pornography': Chrissy Chambers' search for justice
programme.desc: In April, it became a crime in England and Wales to post ‘revenge pornography’. Chrissy Chambers and her girlfriend Bria are YouTube’s most popular lesbian content creators.

programme.title: 'I play Jesus three' | David Hockney's lockdown sunrise and other masterpiece dawns
programme.desc: 'I play Jesus three' | David Hockney's lockdown sunrise and other masterpiece dawns

programme.title: Meet the brewers of the craft beer revolution | Neuro-cuisine: exploring the science of flavour
programme.desc: Meet the brewers of the craft beer revolution | Neuro-cuisine: exploring the science of flavour

programme.title: Happy birthday
programme.desc: For years, global music publisher Warner/Chappell claimed copyright of the Happy Birthday song, demanding payment for any public performance of it.

programme.title: From the Bronx to Yale: the power of high school 'speech'
programme.desc: High school students from Democracy Prep school in the South Bronx, New York, compete against young people across the US at a ‘speech’ competition at Yale University, a form of competitive acting.

programme.title: The pioneering New York prison program transforming lives | Keeping Panini alive in the digital age
programme.desc: Writing wrongs: the pioneering New York prison program transforming lives | Meet the stickerheads: the people keeping Panini alive in the digital age

programme.desc: Why do so many black people love Kung Fu movies? | Why are period dramas so white?

programme.title: The Pegasus project
programme.desc: A special investigation into NSO Group, which sells hacking spyware to governments.

programme.title: Why?
programme.desc: Why Bitcoin is so bad for the planet | Why we are all attracted to conspiracy theories

programme.title: Dwarfism and me: 'We're still treated as less than human'
programme.desc: About 90,000 people in America have dwarfism. The writer and podcaster Cara Reedy takes us on a journey to reflect on what it means to be a person with dwarfism – and why America's obsession with little people has left lasting damage.

programme.title: The Great Abandonment: the extraordinary exodus of India's migrant labourers
programme.desc: In 2020, the Indian prime minister, Narendra Modi, announced one of the harshest Covid lockdowns in the world, causing nearly 200 million migrant labourers to be stranded without wages, food and housing.

programme.title: Muxes
programme.desc: In Juchitán, Mexico, muxes – children identified as male at birth, but who choose at a young age to be raised as female – are embraced as part of the community.

programme.title: Abortion in Mexico | The women protesting Poland's new abortion law
programme.desc: Abortion in Mexico: Catholics, the law and the right to choose | 'Sex is not a crime': the women protesting Poland's new abortion law

programme.title: Death at Sea | Inner-city cricket: The Midlands. Is ethnic minority talent being missed?
programme.desc: Death at sea: Syrian migrants film their perilous voyage to Europe | Inner-city cricket: The Midlands. Is ethnic minority talent being missed?

programme.title: Beirut Dreams in Color
programme.desc: Mashrou’ Leila were one of the biggest bands in the Middle East, with a lead singer, Hamed, who is the most prominent openly gay rock star in the Arab world. Known globally, their gigs were regular sell-out successes until an event at their 2017 Cairo concert changed everything.

programme.title: On the road
programme.desc: Hundreds of women operate as sex workers along the Strada Bonifica, the ironically named ‘road of love’ on the Adriatic coast of Italy.

programme.title: YouTube kids: how unboxing, gaming and toy reviews took over
programme.desc: Being a YouTuber is now the most popular aspiration for children today, according to a survey. In 2018, the site’s highest earner was a seven-year-old American toy reviewer.

programme.title: The Breadmaker: Venezuelan activists fighting to feed a community
programme.desc: Natalia Molina and other members of La Minka, a Chavista collective, run a revolutionary bakery in the Venezuelan capital. They have been occupying the shop in Caracas since March 2017 in an attempt to provide their local community with affordable food.

programme.title: Dallas Detective agency | Why journalists carry guns in the Philippines
programme.desc: Dallas Detective agency | Why journalists carry guns in the Philippines

programme.title: Lives Instead of Knives: one woman's struggle to end knife crime
programme.desc: Smith's Farm Estate in Northolt, north-west London, has been the scene of multiple stabbings. After one murder came particularly close to home, community volunteer Jen Lock began a one-woman mission to end knife crime in the area. But, as she finds out, things don’t always go smoothly.

programme.title: The Agenda
programme.desc: A weekly talk-show looking beyond the headlines and “accepted wisdom” to find the real story. Hosted by award-winning journalist and presenter Stephen Cole, The Agenda quite simply sets The Agenda . You won’t find the same-old talking heads recycling platitudes; instead thought-provoking guests to debate and explore key issues of today’s world. Using virtual reality graphics to bring subjects to life, Stephen will navigate through subjects ranging from “Prove That Climate Change Exists” to “Who Will Win the Race to Space”. Opposing views will be given opportunity to flourish and develop into a meaningful conversation.

programme.title: Razor
programme.desc: CGTN's brand new science and technology show, covering cutting edge developments from all over the world. RAZOR will show you the world's most powerful laser and the world's smallest anti-cancer treatment. It will take you from the weird world of quantum computing to the boundaries of the cosmos. An international team of reporters will follow the guidance of Occam's Razor - the principle that the simplest explanation is the best one. RAZOR will show that we are already "living in the future"!

programme.title: Today’s Top Pick
programme.desc: Documentaries in this slot are rebroadcasts of our most-viewed and most popular stories of the season. They feature important social, economic, environmental or other policy-driven issues, affecting lives nationwide or simply in one small village. A broad selection of top productions by Chinese top documentary producers.

programme.title: Humanities and Geography
programme.desc: A strand devoted to the nature and wildlife of China, the people who lived alongside them, and the great and diverse landscapes with which they all contend.

programme.title: Living China
programme.desc: Real life stories told from the personal perspective. Moving, dramatic, sorrows and joys, expressed emphatically and expressed quietly. Watch closely to see and understand the real China as it is lived.

programme.title: Special Edition
programme.desc: Prestige Chinese documentary production, tackling serious subjects with the best cinematography, editing, and all round production values with a unique Chinese perspective.

programme.title: Journeys and Discoveries
programme.desc: A documentary series showcasing the history of China and its people.

programme.title: History in the Frame
programme.desc: A documentary series featuring historical and archaeological exploration.

programme.title: Best Eats
programme.desc: Food connects people! A feast for the eyes that spotlights the cuisines of China in a way that’s bound to set the mouths of the whole globe watering!

programme.title: Youthful China
programme.desc: The youth of a country is the future of that country. A series of documentaries focusing on the younger generation of China in which you get to see what they are achieving and what makes them tick!

programme.title: Pixel Collage
programme.desc: A well-crafted collage of selected short documentaries telling stories about all aspects of China! People, technology, culture, and wildlife, all are showcased in Internet-friendly form.

programme.title: Humanities and Geography
programme.desc: A strand devoted to the nature and wildlife of China, the people who lived alongside them, and the great and diverse landscapes with which they all contend.

programme.title: Living China
programme.desc: Real life stories told from the personal perspective. Moving, dramatic, sorrows and joys, expressed emphatically and expressed quietly. Watch closely to see and understand the real China as it is lived.

programme.title: Special Edition
programme.desc: Prestige Chinese documentary production, tackling serious subjects with the best cinematography, editing, and all round production values with a unique Chinese perspective.

programme.title: Journeys and Discoveries
programme.desc: A documentary series showcasing the history of China and its people.

programme.title: History in the Frame
programme.desc: A documentary series featuring historical and archaeological exploration.

programme.title: Best Eats
programme.desc: Food connects people! A feast for the eyes that spotlights the cuisines of China in a way that’s bound to set the mouths of the whole globe watering!

programme.title: Youthful China
programme.desc: The youth of a country is the future of that country. A series of documentaries focusing on the younger generation of China in which you get to see what they are achieving and what makes them tick!

programme.desc: A well-crafted collage of selected short documentaries telling stories about all aspects of China! People, technology, culture, and wildlife, all are showcased in Internet-friendly form.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S04 : E08 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S4 Ep8
programme.desc: Zabytkowy most w Pensylwanii musi stawić czoła Matce Naturze. Nowojorską dzielnicą wstrząsa katastrofa budowlana. Zapada się szpitalny parking w Neapolu.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S04 : E09 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S4 Ep9
programme.desc: Katastrofa uderza w przeprawę rzeczną w stanie Nowy Jork. Zawalenie się dźwigu wstrzymuje duży projekt kolejowy we Włoszech. W Szwecji robotnicy uciekają z walącego się mostu.

programme.title: Ciężarówką po bezdrożach Australii
programme.sub-title: S05 : E10 Ciężarówką po bezdrożach Australii S5 Ep10
programme.desc: Mark Cromwell i jego zespół pracują nad dostarczeniem wartej 8 milionów dolarów elektrowni na mikronezyjską wyspę. Sludge wyrusza w australijski outback, aby dostarczyć niezbędne paliwo.

programme.title: Ciężarówką po bezdrożach Australii
programme.sub-title: S05 : E11 Ciężarówką po bezdrożach Australii S5 Ep11
programme.desc: Yogi ma zbyt mało czasu dla rodziny. Mark Cromwell zmaga się z niekończącymi się problemami. Brad Duckworth przewozi swoją ciężarówką cały obóz dla robotników przez centrum Australii.

programme.title: Ciężarówką po bezdrożach Australii
programme.sub-title: S05 : E12 Ciężarówką po bezdrożach Australii S5 Ep12
programme.desc: Firma Mackay House Movers przewozi dwie ogromne części domu z Brisbane na farmę w pobliżu Condamine. Mark Cromwell przewozi buldożery dla poszukiwaczy opali w pobliżu Coober Pedy.

programme.title: Ciężarówką po bezdrożach Australii
programme.sub-title: S05 : E13 Ciężarówką po bezdrożach Australii S5 Ep13
programme.desc: Zespół Robbiego Mackay'a przewozi 35-tonowy dom i walczy z problemami. 31-letni Mick Brett transportuje 65-tonową wieżę z Newcastle na farmę wiatrową White Rock — i jest na granicy wytrzymałości.

programme.title: Ciężarówką po bezdrożach Australii
programme.sub-title: S06 : E01 Ciężarówką po bezdrożach Australii S6 Ep1
programme.desc: Nick i Jo ryzykują jeszcze jedną dostawę do odległej osady po raz ostatni przed porą deszczową. Craig i jego syn przemierzają 3000 kilometrów, aby dostarczyć siano na tereny dotknięte suszą.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Australijscy poławiacze homarów S2 Ep4
programme.desc: Załoga kutra Bold Contender zmierza w stronę Pedra Blanca, miejsca słynącego z ogromnych fal. Niewielu poławiaczy homarów zapuszcza się w te trudne i niebezpieczne rejony.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.sub-title: S02 : E05 Australijscy poławiacze homarów S2 Ep5
programme.desc: Życie na morzu bywa bardzo samotne — zwłaszcza kiedy jesteś poławiaczem homarów. Kapitan Squizzy i Deckie Tabor wracają z pustymi ładowniami, bo na morzu pojawiły się tajemnicze iskrzyłudy.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.sub-title: S02 : E06 Australijscy poławiacze homarów S2 Ep6
programme.desc: Załoga kutra Ella Rose łowi homary nieopodal Three Hummock Island na północ od Tasmanii. Złapali już największego homara tego sezonu — olbrzyma ważącego 3,8 kg — ale nie zamierzają na tym poprzestać.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.sub-title: S02 : E07 Australijscy poławiacze homarów S2 Ep7
programme.desc: Załoga kutra Bold Contender rusza w ostatni rejs zimowego sezonu; kapitan Squizzy ma na pokładzie homary warte ponad 30 tys. dolarów, ale pojawia się poważny problem.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.sub-title: S02 : E08 Australijscy poławiacze homarów S2 Ep8
programme.desc: To już ostatni tydzień zimowego sezonu połowów. Potężny przypływ w Cieśninie Bassa pcha kuter Ella Rose na ostre jak brzytwy skały Three Hummock Island.

programme.title: Nefrytowa gorączka
programme.desc: Zaczyna się akcja wydobycia 40-tonowego głazu na zlecenie kupca z Malezji; Larry chce kupić ładowarkę do kłód, ale znajduje starą, wojskową ciężarówkę; Ricky ładuje swoją ciężarówkę w stylu Larry'ego!

programme.title: Nefrytowa gorączka
programme.sub-title: S07 : E10 Bez pracy nie ma nefrytu
programme.desc: Ekipa wydobywa nefryt ze złoża J, ale duża dziura w drodze zagraża całej operacji. Larry znajduje nowy sposób na szybkie pieniądze, ale wkrótce odkrywa, że nic nie jest takie proste, jak się wydawało.

programme.title: Australijscy poszukiwacze złota
programme.sub-title: S02 : E01 Australijscy poszukiwacze złota S2 Ep1
programme.desc: Po trudnych pięciu miesiącach przerwy zespół Dirt Dogs zaczyna kolejny sezon, który zadecyduje o jego przyszłości. Nowe maszyny dają szansę na zdobycie prawdziwego bogactwa.

programme.title: Australijscy poszukiwacze złota
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Australijscy poszukiwacze złota S2 Ep2
programme.desc: W ostatnim sezonie Chris i Greg Clarkowie nie wydobyli tyle złota, ile planowali. Teraz stawiają wszystko na jedną kartę — ale złe wieści sprawiają, że ryzykowna umowa może obrócić się przeciwko nim.

programme.title: Australijscy poszukiwacze złota
programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 Australijscy poszukiwacze złota S2 Ep3
programme.desc: Henri i Kellie zaczęli sezon w doskonałej formie. Teraz ruszają nad jezioro Cowan z nowym sprzętem, ale ich plany zdobycia fortuny zostaną wystawione na ciężką próbę.

programme.title: Górscy cieśle
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Powrót na plac budowy
programme.desc: Paolo i Giovanni Curzelowie muszą wznowić budowę schroniska Brentei w ciągu zaledwie trzech miesięcy.

programme.title: Górscy cieśle
programme.desc: Na placu budowy schroniska Brentei rośnie napięcie — dziś na miejscu zjawi się Germano, znany z braku elastyczności założyciel firmy Curzel.

programme.title: Górscy cieśle
programme.desc: Tym razem wyzwaniem dla Curzelów jest zbudowanie od podstaw nowego drewnianego schronu biwakowego na szczycie góry Fravort, na wysokości 2347 metrów nad poziomem morza.

programme.title: Górscy cieśle
programme.desc: Niespodziewane wydarzenie zmusza braci do opuszczenia swoich placów budowy i odwiedzenia schroniska na Cima d'Asta.

programme.title: Górscy cieśle
programme.desc: W schronisku Brentei nie ma ani chwili do stracenia: zbliża się zima i trzeba rozpocząć prace budowlane nad schronem biwakowym.

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Australijscy poławiacze homarów S2 Ep4
programme.desc: Załoga kutra Bold Contender zmierza w stronę Pedra Blanca, miejsca słynącego z ogromnych fal. Niewielu poławiaczy homarów zapuszcza się w te trudne i niebezpieczne rejony.

programme.title: Drwale z Kolumbii Brytyjskiej
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Kłopoty w głębi lasu
programme.desc: Craig jest sfrustrowany niekończącymi się awariami, kierowca walczy z chroniczną kontuzją pleców, aby nie przerywać pracy, a przyczepa do przewozu drewna wypada z drogi.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.sub-title: S04 : E10 Największe pomyłki inżynierów S4 Ep10
programme.desc: Nowy most w Ottawie okazuje się mieć słaby punkt. Jedna z najsłynniejszych budowli na świecie dzieli krytyków w Sydney. Co spowodowało zawalenie się jednego z najbardziej znanych włoskich mostów?

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.sub-title: S02 : E08 Australijscy poławiacze homarów S2 Ep8
programme.desc: To już ostatni tydzień zimowego sezonu połowów. Potężny przypływ w Cieśninie Bassa pcha kuter Ella Rose na ostre jak brzytwy skały Three Hummock Island.

programme.title: Drwale z Kolumbii Brytyjskiej
programme.desc: Odwilż wczesną wiosną sprawia, że projekt budowy drogi staje się dla Brenta i Taylora bitwą z błotem. Szef otrzymuje nieoczekiwaną wiadomość, która może zagrozić całej jego działalności.

programme.title: Największe pomyłki inżynierów
programme.desc: Eksplozja wstrząsa miasteczkiem West w Teksasie; eksperci wykorzystują najnowsze osiągnięcia naukowe do zbadania sprawy. Okazuje się, że do wybuchu doszło w pobliskiej fabryce nawozów sztucznych.

programme.title: Australijscy poszukiwacze złota
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Australijscy poszukiwacze złota S2 Ep4
programme.desc: Po znalezieniu rzadko spotykanego złotego złoża członkowie ekipy Dirt Dogs mają wielkie plany, ale szybko pojawiają się problemy, przez które wszystko pogrąża się w chaosie.

programme.title: Ciężarówką po bezdrożach Australii
programme.sub-title: S06 : E02 Ciężarówką po bezdrożach Australii S6 Ep2
programme.desc: Rodzeństwo Robbie i Ashleigh bierze udział w wyjątkowo błotnistej przeprowadzce z Brisbane. Nick i Jo walczą z burzami w dalekiej Australii Zachodniej.

programme.title: Górscy cieśle
programme.desc: Curzelowie przygotowują się do zimy, szykując wyposażenie wnętrza dla schroniska Brentei. Czy uda im się zakończyć wszystkie prace i udostępnić budynek turystom?

programme.title: Australijscy poławiacze homarów
programme.sub-title: S05 : E01 Australijscy poławiacze homarów S5 Ep1
programme.desc: Bryce wyrusza wcześnie. Myles trafia na szczyt tabeli wyników. Jack nadal jest uziemiony. Na scenie pojawia się tajemniczy kapitan.
